identity.name: HelplineOS
principles: Clarity over Decoration: Data must be readable at a glance.
Calm in Chaos: Use neutral tones to reduce cognitive load.
Speed is a Feature: Interactions must be instant and keyboard-friendly.
Human Touch: Use subtle warmth in colors to avoid a sterile 'hospital' feel.

rules: Use 'Manrope' for all headings to give a modern, geometric feel.
Use 'Inter' for all data tables, inputs, and body text for maximum legibility.
Labels must be uppercase, small, and wide-spaced ('text-xs uppercase tracking-wider').

primary.name: Deep Slate
primary.usage: Primary buttons, active states, key text

rules: Avoid pure black (#000000). Use Deep Slate for high contrast.
Backgrounds should be 'Paper White' (hsl(210, 20%, 98%)) in light mode, not pure white.
Use the Accent color (Burnt Sienna) sparinglyâ€”only for the most important action on the screen.
Status colors should be muted, not neon.

grid_system.dashboard: Mode B: The Control Room Grid (Dense, Data-Heavy)
grid_system.marketing: Mode A: The Tetris Grid (Not applicable here, but good for login page)
grid_system.gap: gap-4 or gap-6 for dashboard; gap-8 for login/landing

spacing.philosophy: Generous internal padding in cards (p-6) to prevent 'cramped' data.
spacing.containers: Max-width containers for readability (max-w-7xl for dashboard).

cards.style: Flat, 1px border (border-border), no shadow or very subtle shadow-sm.

tables.style: Clean rows, no vertical borders. Header text-muted-foreground uppercase text-xs.

visual_enhancers.glassmorphism: Use for sticky headers and modals: bg-white/70 backdrop-blur-xl border-b border-white/20.
visual_enhancers.gradients: NO gradients for backgrounds. Use solid colors or subtle noise textures.
visual_enhancers.shadows: Minimalist. shadow-sm for cards, shadow-lg for dropdowns/modals.

motion.page_load: Fade in (opacity-0 to opacity-100) with slight slide up.

image_urls.description: Abstract geometric neutral background for Login Page

media.icons: Use 'lucide-react' (default). For specialized dashboard icons, use 'phosphor-icons' if needed.

accessibility.contrast: Ensure text meets WCAG AA (4.5:1). Use 'text-foreground' on 'bg-background'.
accessibility.focus_states: Visible focus rings (ring-2 ring-accent) are MANDATORY for keyboard navigation.
accessibility.aria_labels: All icon-only buttons must have aria-label.

instructions_to_main_agent: 1. SETUP: Ensure Tailwind config uses the 'Soft Utility' color palette defined above.
2. COMPONENTS: Use Shadcn components for all interactive elements. Customize them to match the 'Flat & Sharp' aesthetic.
3. LAYOUT: Implement the 'Control Room Grid' for the Dashboard. Use 'Split View' for the Call Log page.
4. LOGIN: Build a high-impact Login page using the provided abstract background image.
5. DATA: Use 'Recharts' for the Call Statistics on the dashboard.
6. TESTING: Add 'data-testid' to all interactive elements.
universal_guidelines: You tend to converge toward generic, 'on distribution' outputs. In frontend design, this creates what users call the 'AI slop' aesthetic. Avoid this: make creative, distinctive frontends that surprise and delight.
Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur)
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: 'transition: all'. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add '.App { text-align: center; }' in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
